page.title: 06The Coastguard
page.content: This service started in 1822 and came here in 1934 Our station is in one of the four Martello Towers which are still found in Felixstowe (the fifth , with the Dooley Fort was demolished when the dock expanded recently) These towers were built in 1810 as defence against Napoleon's French armies The Coastguard in Felixstowe is responsible for the safety of the coastline between the rivers Deben and Orwell. The main dangers here are the rapid weather changes and the prevailing winds. Most emergencies occur in the summer when there is much tourism although fishermen need this service throughout the year. The sea defences. The Suffolk Coastal District Council spend 20 to 30 thousand pounds a year on sea defences. The wall design is attractive but was not built with tourism in mind.
